title: How did Luke Perry’s character die in Riverdale?
text:
Luke Perry will be given an emotional send off in the first episdoe of Riverdale, Season 4 (Picture: CW/Backgrid)

Earlier this year Hollywood mourned the death of much-loved actor Luke Perry and now his former Riverdale cast members will be seen mourning once again in season four of the show

The show’s characters will pay tribute to the actor with a heartbreaking farewell episode to his character Fred Andrews.

Actor Luke Perry died after suffering a stroke in March 2019 aged just 52. Tonight, when Riverdale returns to Netflix, the show will address Luke’s sudden and tragic death and explain the loss of his character Fred in the storyline.

Keen to pay tribute to the well-loved star, who originally found fame on Beverly Hills, 90210, writer Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa said of the episode: ‘I think it’s a real tribute to Luke. I think it’s a real tribute to Fred.

‘I think it’s very cathartic to watch it and I think everyone really came together, specifically to tell this kind of story, to honour Luke and honour Fred,’ Roberto told E! News back in August.

Struggling to find the words, he added: ‘It’s a really simple, it’s one of our…just beautiful.’

So how do Riverdale address Luke Perry’s death in the new season of Riverdale?

Riverdale writers have penned a touching tribute episode to the late Luke Perry. (picture: CW / BACKGRID)

How did Luke Perry die in Riverdale?

In the first episode of season 4, appropriately titled In Memoriam, Luke Perry’s former Beverly Hills, 90210 co-star Shannen Doherty makes an appearance in Riverdale to honour the late star and pay tribute to him.

The episode opens with Fred’s son Archie (KJ Apa) receiving a phone call from police inside Pop’s Diner, during which he learns of his father’s death.

FP Jones (Skeet Ulrich) tells Archie that Fred was travelling back to Riverdale when he decided to stop and help a motorist on the side of the road, only for him to be killed in a hit and run while assisting the stranger.

The stranger in question is Shannen Doherty’s character and she tells Archie on meeting him at the site of the crash that Fred had actually saved her life by pushing her out of the way of the incoming car before the crash.

The Riverdale cast have paid tribute to Luke both on and off screen (Picture: CW / BACKGRID)

A number of the Riverdale cast posted messages on social media to commemorate Luke, with star Lili Reinhart writing: ‘Tonight’s episode, and all episodes for the rest of our run, are for Luke.’
